intro: Senecio piedrahitae, commonly known as the Chihuahua groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Chihuahua region of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in a fine layer of hair, aiding in water retention. Senecio piedrahitae is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, where it thrives with minimal water and nutrients.
